required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Clinical Trial to Evaluate CD19 CAR T (CT032) in Patients With Relapsed and/or Refractory Non-Hodgkin's B Cell Lymphoma
clinical_study.official_title: An Open, Multi-center Phase Ⅰ/II Clinical Study to Evaluate the Safety and Efficacy of CT032 Humanized CD19 Autologous Car T Cell Injection in Patients With Relapsed and/or Refractory Non-Hodgkin's B Cell Lymphoma

collaborator.agency: First Affiliated Hospital of Zhejiang University

brief_summary.textblock: This is an open-label, single arm study to evaluate the safety and tolerability of treatment with CT032 CAR-CD19 T in patients with relapsed and/or refractory non-Hodgkin's B cell lymphoma (R/R B-NHL).

detailed_description.textblock: This study is a single-arm, open label, phase I/II clinical trial to evaluate the safety, efficacy and cellular kinetics of CT032 CAR-CD19 T cells in patients with R/R B-NHL. The study is composed of two stages, Phase I stage is for dose escalation and recommendation of phase 2 dose, and Phase II stage is to verify the efficacy and safety of the dose proposed.

primary_outcome.time_frame: 28 days post administration of CAR-T cells

primary_outcome.measure: Phase Ⅰ, Safety/Tolerability: Maximum tolerated dose (MTD)
primary_outcome.time_frame: 28 days post administration of CAR-T cells

primary_outcome.measure: Phase Ⅰ, Safety/Tolerability: Incidence and severity of Treatment emergent adverse events (TEAE)
primary_outcome.time_frame: 28 days post administration of CAR-T cells
primary_outcome.description: Incidence and severity of Treatment emergent adverse events (TEAE)

primary_outcome.measure: Phase Ⅰ, Safety/Tolerability: Incidence and severity of study treatment related AE
primary_outcome.time_frame: through 2 months post administration of CAR-T cells
primary_outcome.description: Incidence and severity of AE related to study treatment

primary_outcome.measure: Phase Ⅰ, Safety/Tolerability: Incidence and severity of AEs of special interest (cytokine release syndrome [CRS], CART-cell-related encephalopathy syndrome [CRES])
primary_outcome.time_frame: through 2 months post administration of CAR-T cells
primary_outcome.description: Incidence and severity of AEs of special interest (cytokine release syndrome [CRS], CART-cell-related encephalopathy syndrome [CRES])

primary_outcome.measure: Phase Ⅰ, Safety/Tolerability: Incidence and severity of Dose-limiting toxicity (DLT) of dose escalation experiment
primary_outcome.description: Incidence and severity of Dose-limiting toxicity (DLT) of dose escalation experiment

primary_outcome.measure: Phase Ⅰ, Safety/Tolerability: Recommended Phase II Dose (RP2D)
primary_outcome.time_frame: through 2 months post administration of CAR-T cells

primary_outcome.measure: Phase Ⅱ, Efficacy: Overall Remission Rate (ORR)
primary_outcome.time_frame: through 6 months post administration of CAR-T cells
primary_outcome.description: Overall Remission Rate (ORR) (Partial remission and complete remission rate after infusion of CT032 CAR-CD19 T cells)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: through 24 months post administration of CAR-T cells

secondary_outcome.description: Cytokine (IL-2, IL-6,IL-8,IL-10,IFN-γ,TNF-α ) concentration (pg/mL) by MSD and CBA method

secondary_outcome.time_frame: through 24 months post administration of CAR-T cells
secondary_outcome.description: the number of copies of CAR-CD19 T cells in peripheral blood genomes by qPCR method and CAR-CD19 T cells by flow cytometry method

secondary_outcome.description: Overall Remission Rate (ORR) (Partial remission and complete remission rate after infusion of CT032 CAR-CD19 T cells)

arm_group.description: The subjects are enrolled into 3 dose levels cohorts in sequence.

intervention.description: The CAR- CD19 T cells (study drug) used in this study are chimeric antigen receptor specifically expressing T cells targeting CD19. Fludarabine and Cyclophosphamide are used for lymphodepletion.

overall_official.affiliation: First Affiliated Hospital of Zhejiang University
